text: Balaam Continues to Utter Oracles

And Balaam saw that ⸤it pleased⸥\f + \fr 24:1 \ft Literally “it was good in the eyes of Yahweh” \f* Yahweh to bless Israel, and he did not go ⸤as other times⸥\f + \fr 24:1 \ft Literally “as time on time” \f* ⸤to seek out⸥\f + \fr 24:1 \ft Literally “to meet” \f* sorcery; instead, he set his face toward the desert.
Balaam lift up his eyes, and he saw Israel dwelling according to its tribes, and the spirit of God was upon it.\f + \fr 24:2 \ft That is, Israel \f*
He ⸤uttered⸥\f + \fr 24:3 \ft Literally “lifted up” \f* his oracle and said,
“The declaration of Balaam son Beor,
the declaration of the man \add whose\add* eyes are closed,
the declaration of the hearer of God’s words,\f + \fr 24:4 \ft Or “God’s sayings” \f*
who sees the revelation of Shaddai,\f + \fr 24:4 \ft Often translated “the Almighty” \f*
falling down but \add whose\add* eyes are uncovered.
How good are your tents, O Jacob,
your dwellings, O Israel!
They are spread out like valleys,
like gardens on a river,
like aloes planted by Yahweh,
like cedars at \add the\add* waters.
He will pour water from his buckets,
and his offspring \add will be\add* like many waters;
his king will be higher than Agag,
and his kingdom will be exalted.
God, who brings him out from Egypt,
\add is\add* like the strength\f + \fr 24:8 \ft Or “the horns” \f* of a wild ox for him.
He will devour \add the\add* nations \add who are\add* his enemies;
he will break their bones;
he will pierce \add them with\add* his arrows.
He crouches, he lies down like a lion,
and like a lioness, who will rouse him?
\add They who\add* bless you will be blessed,
and \add they who\add* curse you will be cursed.”

Then ⸤Balak became angry with⸥\f + \fr 24:10 \ft Literally “the nose of Balak became hot against” \f* Balaam, and he clapped his hands and said to Balaam, “I called you to curse my enemies, but look, you have surely blessed \add them\add* these three times.
⸤Flee⸥\f + \fr 24:11 \ft Literally “Flee for yourself” \f* to your place now. I said I would richly honor you, but look, Yahweh has withheld honor from you.”
Balaam said to Balak, “Did I not speak to your messengers whom you sent to me, saying,

‘If Balak gave to me the fullness of his house full of silver and gold, I am not able to go beyond ⸤the command of Yahweh⸥\f + \fr 24:13 \ft Literally “the mouth of Yahweh” \f* to do good or evil, from my heart; what Yahweh speaks, I will speak’?\f + \fr 24:13 \ft Hebrew “I will speak it” \f*
And now, look, I \add am about\add* to go to my people; I will advise you what this people will do to your people ⸤in the following days⸥.”\f + \fr 24:14 \ft Literally “in the last of the days” \f*
And he ⸤uttered⸥\f + \fr 24:15 \ft Literally “lifted up” \f* his oracle and said,
“The declaration of Balaam son of Beor,
and the declaration of the man whose eye is closed,
the declaration of the hearer of God’s words,\f + \fr 24:16 \ft Or “God’s sayings” \f*
and the knower of the knowledge of the Most High,
who sees the vision of Shaddai,\f + \fr 24:16 \ft Often translated “the Almighty” \f*
who is falling, and \add his\add* eyes \add are\add* revealed.
I see him, but not now;
I behold him, but not near;
a star will go out from Jacob,
and a scepter will rise from Israel;
it will crush the foreheads of Moab
and destroy all the children of Seth.
Edom will be a captive;
Seir, its enemies, will be a captive,
and Israel \add will be\add* acting ⸤courageously⸥.\f + \fr 24:18 \ft Literally “\fq with \ft physical strength” \f*
Someone\f + \fr 24:19 \ft Hebrew “He” \f* from Jacob will rule
and will destroy a remnant\f + \fr 24:19 \ft Or “survivor” \f* from the city.”
And he looked \add at\add* Amalek, ⸤uttered⸥\f + \fr 24:20 \ft Literally “lifted up” \f* his oracle, and said,
“Amalek \add is\add* first\f + \fr 24:20 \ft Or “among” \f* of \add the\add* nations,
but his future \add will be\add* forever ruin.”
And he looked \add at\add* the Kenites,\f + \fr 24:21 \ft Hebrew “Kenite” \f* ⸤uttered⸥\f + \fr 24:21 \ft Literally “lifted up” \f* his oracle, and said,
“Steady \add is\add* your dwelling place;
in the rock is your nest.
Nevertheless, \add the\add* Kenite will be burned;
how long will Asshur keep\f + \fr 24:22 \ft Hebrew “take” \f* you captive?”
Again he ⸤uttered⸥\f + \fr 24:23 \ft Literally “lifted up” \f* his oracle and said,
“Woe, who will live when God establishes this?\f + \fr 24:23 \ft Hebrew “it” \f*
The ships \add will come\add* from the hand of the Kittim,
and they will afflict Asshur and will afflict Eber;
also he \add will be\add* forever ruin.”
Then Balaam got up and went and returned to his place, and Balak also went on his way.
